		<title>Modern Healthcare Breaking News</title>

<item>
  <title>Week ahead: ONC and CMS seek to understand clinician tech burden</title> 
  <link>http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219921</link> 
  <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 00:01:00 EST</pubDate> 
  <description>As required by the 21st Century Cures Act, the two agencies are meeting with clinicians and others to discuss the burdens that may arise from using EHRs.</description> 
  <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219921</guid>
  </item>

<item>
  <title>Collide or collaborate? Community health centers and hospitals work through their overlap</title> 
  <link>http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219923</link> 
  <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 00:01:00 EST</pubDate> 
  <description>Community health centers are a powerful player in the towns they serve, and some hospitals are finding themselves on a collision course of competition. In an increasingly complex landscape, can these two uneasy bedfellows make peace?</description> 
  <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219923</guid>
  </item>

<item>
  <title>Lifelike medical dummies animate training at Advocate</title> 
  <link>http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/BLOG/180219925</link> 
  <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 00:01:00 EST</pubDate> 
  <description>At Advocate's second simulation center, clinicians and others practice improving patient safety.</description> 
  <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/BLOG/180219925</guid>
  </item>

<item>
  <title>Power Panel members see strong demand for physician practices</title> 
  <link>http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219927</link> 
  <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 00:01:00 EST</pubDate> 
  <description>Drug prices may be the main concern for Power Panel members, but physician practice ownership also has their attention.</description> 
  <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219927</guid>
  </item>

<item>
  <title>CEO Power Panel: Health systems see drugs as fastest-growing expense</title> 
  <link>http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219928</link> 
  <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 00:01:00 EST</pubDate> 
  <description>Modern Healthcare's CEO Power Panel survey indicates healthcare leaders still fear unbridled drug costs and wonder if the industry has reached a breaking point.</description> 
  <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219928</guid>
  </item>

<item>
  <title>Editorial: Is the era of healthcare cost control ending?</title> 
  <link>http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219936</link> 
  <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 00:01:00 EST</pubDate> 
  <description>It's too early to say the era of cost control, which stretched roughly from 2010 to 2016, is over. But as the latest CMS cost projections suggest, the U.S. appears headed into another period when healthcare spending routinely exceeds the economy's...</description> 
  <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219936</guid>
  </item>

<item>
  <title>Do hand dryers spread bacteria? Viral Facebook post causes a stir</title> 
  <link>http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219937</link> 
  <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 00:01:00 EST</pubDate> 
  <description>The viral Facebook post, now shared more than 578,000 times, shows a petri dish swarming with fungi and bacteria collected in an enclosed hand dryer in a women's bathroom.</description> 
  <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219937</guid>
  </item>

<item>
  <title>Radiologists give new perspective on Saint-Gaudens sculpture molds</title> 
  <link>http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219938</link> 
  <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 00:01:00 EST</pubDate> 
  <description>Dartmouth-Hitchcock Medical Center radiologists can now say they've made a contribution to art history. The team used a CT scanner and 3-D printers to view and recreate what's inside of sealed molds of 19th century artist Augustus Saint-Gaudens.</description> 
  <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219938</guid>
  </item>

<item>
  <title>Q&amp;A with Dr. Stephen Klasko: 'My bias is that we talk about the wrong things'</title> 
  <link>http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219939</link> 
  <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 00:01:00 EST</pubDate> 
  <description>From the way medical students are selected and trained to how policy debates are framed, healthcare needs an overhaul, according to Dr. Stephen Klasko, CEO of Thomas Jefferson University and Jefferson Health.</description> 
  <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219939</guid>
  </item>

<item>
  <title>Guest Commentary: Systems must 'let go' of owning everything and focus on patient experience</title> 
  <link>http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219944</link> 
  <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 00:01:00 EST</pubDate> 
  <description>In the old days, healthcare organizations prioritized owning facilities, maximizing volume, optimizing revenue and controlling production in-house. There was little regard for total costs, outcomes or patient experience. Meanwhile, an asset-light...</description> 
  <guid isPermaLink="true">http://www.modernhealthcare.com/article/20180217/NEWS/180219944</guid>
  </item>



	</channel>
</rss>
